name: Snowball Bush Viburnum
climate: The Snowball Bush Viburnum thrives in temperate climates with cool summers.
It can tolerate different climate zones, but severe frost can damage it.
This plant enjoys climates with well-defined seasons, especially spring warmth.
Although adaptable, extreme heat and extreme cold can hinder its growth.
sunlight: Full sun is ideal for abundant blooming of the Snowball Bush Viburnum.
It can grow well in partial shade, but flowering may be reduced.
The plant benefits from sun exposure for at least six hours daily.
Protection from harsh afternoon sun is recommended to prevent leaf scorch.
watering: The Snowball Bush Viburnum prefers consistently moist but not waterlogged soil.
During dry periods, regular watering is necessary to keep the roots hydrated.
Deep watering encourages a robust root system, supporting plant vigor.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so ensure proper drainage.
soil: Well-drained loamy soil enriched with organic matter is ideal for the plant.
The plant can grow in a variety of soil types, including sandy and clay soils.
Soil with a slightly acidic to neutral pH level supports optimal growth.
Compacted soil should be avoided as it hampers drainage and root development.
extra_care_tip: Pruning after flowering helps maintain its shape and encourages new growth.
Mulching at the base retains moisture and suppresses weeds around the plant.
